headline: Palo Alto Networks Reshapes Platform With CyberArk Deal And Tel Aviv Listing
summary: Palo Alto Networks (NasdaqGS:PANW) has completed its $25b acquisition of identity security firm CyberArk. The company has begun a dual listing on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange, adding to its existing Nasdaq listing. Palo Alto Networks also moved to expand into new security markets with the acquisition of observability platform Chronosphere. Palo Alto Networks, best known for its firewall and AI driven security platforms, is now tying identity security more tightly into its broader product...

headline: ServiceNow Inc (NOW) Draws Analyst Attention Amid AI Shift
summary: ServiceNow Inc (NYSE:NOW) is one of the best NYSE stocks to buy for the long term. On February 11, ServiceNow, Inc. (NYSE:NOW) announced the appointment of Danielle Fontaine as chief accounting officer and corporate controller, effective February 17. The update was shared in a press release following a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. […]

headline: Is Palo Alto (PANW) a Buy as Wall Street Analysts Look Optimistic?
summary: The average brokerage recommendation (ABR) for Palo Alto (PANW) is equivalent to a Buy. The overly optimistic recommendations of Wall Street analysts make the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric questionable. So, is it worth buying the stock?

headline: Option Volatility And Earnings Report For February 16 - 20
summary: Earnings season is starting to slow down now, which may come as a welcome relief for some. However, we do still have some important companies due to report with Walmart, Alibaba, Newmont Mining, Medtronic, Palo Alto Networks, DoorDash and Occidental Petroleum all set to report.
